title: Qualcommâ€™s custom Arm processors for Windows PCs are coming late next year
content:
Back in January 2021, Qualcomm acquired Nuvia, a company that was set to bolster its efforts in making custom Arm processors. Right out of the gate, Qualcomm was pretty straightforward about its plans. It was going to use these chips to compete against Apple’s M1 processors, and the first ones would begin sampling to OEMs

The post Qualcomm’s custom Arm processors for Windows PCs are coming late next year appeared first on XDA.
description: During its earnings call, Qualcomm confirmed that its custom processors are still on track to arrive in products later on this year.
